whitebox.ui.plugin_dialog

Class ScriptDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • whitebox.ui.plugin_dialog.ScriptDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener, Communicator

    public class ScriptDialog
extends java.lang.Object
implements Communicator, java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.HyperlinkListener
    This class is used to provide a dialog box for a Whitebox GAT script tool.

      • addDialogCheckBox

        public DialogCheckBox addDialogCheckBox(java.lang.String description,
                                        java.lang.String labelText,
                                        boolean initialState)
        Adds a checkbox to the dialog
        Parameters:
        description - This string is entered into the pop-up description.
        labelText - This string is added to the checkbox label.
        initialState - Determines whether the checkbox is checked at startup.
        Returns:
        DialogCheckBox a reference to the created object.

      • runPlugin

        public void runPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                      java.lang.String[] args,
                      boolean runOnDedicatedThread)
        Used to run a plugin through the Host app.
        Specified by:
        runPlugin in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        pluginName - String containing the descriptive name of the plugin.
        args - String array containing the parameters to feed to the plugin.
        runOnDedicatedThread - boolean value; set to true if the tool should be run on a dedicated thread and false if it should be run on the same thread as the calling Communicator.

      • runPlugin

        public void runPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                      java.lang.String[] args)
        Used to run a plugin through the Host app.
        Specified by:
        runPlugin in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        pluginName - String containing the descriptive name of the plugin.
        args - String array containing the parameters to feed to the plugin.

      • runPlugin

        public void runPlugin(java.lang.String pluginName,
                      java.lang.String[] args,
                      boolean runOnDedicatedThread,
                      boolean suppressReturnedData)
        Description copied from interface: Communicator
        Used to run a plugin through the Host app.
        Specified by:
        runPlugin in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        pluginName - String containing the descriptive name of the plugin.
        args - String array containing the parameters to feed to the plugin.
        runOnDedicatedThread - boolean value; set to true if the tool should be run on a dedicated thread and false if it should be run on the same thread as the calling Communicator.
        suppressReturnedData - boolean value; set to true if the tool should be run without accepting any returned data (e.g. an automatically displayed image). This is a useful parameter for scripting.
